reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel because our son was billeted here while his ship was in the harbor. I'm sure that in its' day it was one of the prime hotels in the area but it is getting on in years. There are signs of wear everywhere you look but there is still a lot of life in the old gal. Our room was very large, clean and quiet with a good mattress. The location is great as you are on the Pacific Coast Highway at the intersection of 2nd Street which has dozens of shops and good restaurants and it is reasonably close to downtown. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Aging princess but still in the game
Great Price, nice rooms and what a great breakfast for only $4.00
reviews.text: My Wife and myself stayed at the Seapport for 3 days, I had a great time, lots of great restaurants all around the hotel. Their must be 40 of them, from every country in the world. The room was clean and warm. We will be back.

reviews.title: peaceful
reviews.text: 1 more thing, enterprise was located in the lobby, I got a car (F150 ford truck) for only $20.00 a day....what a deal. and this is in the City. In LA I would have to pay $45.00 for a car..And $165.00 for a room. I only payed $79.00 for a Marina View room..

reviews.title: Not bad for a old hotel
reviews.text: Thanks Seaport for the wonderfull vacation

reviews.title: wonderful experience
reviews.text: This weekend my family came out. The rooms were nice and clean and fresh. The price was very low for such a pleasant service. The staff was very informative and helpful. The view was so So Cal! Great place to stay in Long Beach for a low cost.

reviews.title: And Smelly to boot
reviews.text: Stayed there on December 12 2004. Originally booked the room for 2 days - at the outrageous price of $99.00 per night. No breaksfast was included in that charge. The room did not have a coffee maker, a fridge or a microwave. The TV was the pits, with a very old converter box and terribly colours....and worst of all, the room was smelly to boot. We cancelled our second night and went elsewhere.

reviews.title: Give me a break!!!! What do people want?
reviews.text: Have had several occassions to have out of town guests stay at the hotel. Never had a complainant from any of them. If one wants the "looks" and "beauty" of a 5 star hotel, they should stay at one and hopefully get their monies worth. For what the prices are at the Seaport, the rooms are clean, the staff very helpful and the service fine. I will agree it could use some remodeling and upgrading, but after spending several million dollars, the price would be that of a Hilton. If you plan on staying at a hotel to spend most of your time in the room, rent an apartment.
